ovdesc.p: The MD.PARAMETER file has a record for each Company.
The valid deal types, sub deal types and category code ranges are set up.
The overall level rules are specified.

desc.p: This is a user defined identifier for the type of MD.DEAL that is to be entered. Given that the name of the application is Miscellaneous Deals it can be envisaged that the types of use this application will see will vary according to the individual banks that use it.

As an example the following structure could be entered where GTREC is a Guarantee Received. It allows just the one CATEGORY of 28110 which falls within the overall range 28100-28199 defined for the CL type.
It is likely that these values are used to provide LIMIT checking (or the CATEGORY code ranges associated with them).
This is just an example and the actual use is dependent on the nature of your business and your specific requirements.
1 - 5 alphanumeric characters.
Mandatory Input
Once the record has been authorised this field cannot be changed.

t.desc:
Switch to decide whether contingent entries should be raised online or at the end of day. The user can select either ONLINE or END OF DAY.
This value will be defaulted in the MD contract.
If set to ONLINE,
Limit updated dynamically for same day
for Negative Principal movements as well.
Customer position is updated
Contingent entries are raise online for:
New deals
Reversals
Same day principal movements
Change in principal movements
At start of day, update limits and raise contingent entries for :-
Change in status (forward dated deals becoming LIVE)
Effecting scheduled principal movements, updating limits etc
If set to END OF DAY,
The existing
flow will be maintained.
Validation Rules:
Mandatory input.
Can either be ONLINE or END OF DAY.

desc.p: MD.CLASS.TYPE

These message classes are raised by the MD Application for production of messages. This along with EB.CLASS.TYPE are used to formulate the class mapping. The main driving concept of ACTIVITY and CLASS lends itself to facilitate the user to trigger the messages related to the operation.

The system will try to default a sensible CLASS tiding to the corresponding activity, populate the information in MD Transaction. The user may however select the apt CLASS to choose production of appropriate messages.
Valid inputs are:
ACKNOWLEDGEMENT
ADDITIONAL.MSG
ADVICE.THRU
BANKADVICE
BASIC.MESSAGE
CANCELLATION
CREDIT.CUST
CSN.CREDIT
CSN.DEBIT
DEBIT.CUST
NOTIFICATION
PARTICIPATION
PROVISION.CREDIT
PROVISION.DEBIT
USER.DEFINE1
USER.DEFINE2
USER.DEFINE9
Only the aforesaid list of values are permitted.
EB.CLASS.TYPE

INCLUDE.PROVISION
If set to YES, the impact on limit will be reduced to the extent of the provision taken against the deal.
If set to NO, irrespective of any provision taken for the deal, the limit will get hit for the entire principal of the Leader of the deal.
The value input here will be defaulted in the Deal. A NULL value however, will be treated as NO.
Valid inputs are 'YES' or 'NO'

1 - 35 alphanumeric characters.
Mandatory Input
This field indicates whether the commission and charge is to be processed at SOD or EOD of the scheduled date.
Acceptable values are YES, NO and None. If YES, then the processing will take place during SOD and if NO or None, then the
processing will take place during EOD of the scheduled date. The value defined will get defaulted at the contract level.
However, time of processing (SOD or EOD) will be determined by the value at the contract level irrespective of the value at the parameter level.
Acceptable values are Yes, No and None
PART.CSN.ACC
The account category (10000 - 19999) in which the Participant' share in the commission will be parked along with Tax.
An Internal account needs to be created in the local currency in this category. The system will automatically open accounts for the other currencies whenever needed.
Must be between 10000 and 19999.
Must be in CATEGORY table
EXPIRY.MODE
If set to AUTOMATIC, the field AUTO.EXPIRY at the Deal is defaulted to YES.
If set to MANUAL, the field AUTO.EXPIRY at the Deal is defaulted to NO.

This feature is enabled to cater to situations, where the Deal is kept live even past its Maturity date. When set to YES, the deal is defaulted with the value YES in AUTO.EXPIRY enabling the record to move to history. This however may be overridden at the Deal.

Incase the mode is set as MANUAL, the Deal is defaulted with NO, preventing the record to move to history. This caters to scenarios where the record has to be kept live until the original Guarantee is returned.
Should either be AUTOMATIC or MANUAL

desc.p: Value in this field decides the stage at which the customer's limit must be updated when request for issuance of guarantee is initiated through Internet Banking.
Allowed values are "YES" or "NO".
If "YES", the customer's limit will be checked and updated when the Corporate customer requests for issuance of guarantee through Internet Banking.
If "NO", then the customer's limit will be checked and updated only when the request is approved at the Bank side.
Specifies no of days for executing invocation.
Accepted values - (No.of.days)(C or W).
Used only in enquiries.
To define the number of days within which a decision has to be taken for any invocation claims received.
Accepts valid days format - +NNX – Where n stands for 2 numeric digits representing the number of days and X denotes the calendar days (C ) or working days (W).
Optional input.
Enquiries can be created to list the guarantees with outstanding claims, for which decision has to be taken within the specific period.
